channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: ViT-CoMer: Vision Transformer with Convolutional Multi-scale Feature Interaction for Dense Predictions
item.description: Compared to the stateof-the-art, ViT-CoMer has the following advantages: (1) We inject spatial pyramid multi-receptive field convolutional features into the ViT architecture, which effectively alleviates the problems of limited local information interaction and single-feature representation in ViT.

item.title: On Ranking-based Tests of Independence
item.description: In this paper we develop a novel nonparametric framework to test the independence of two random variables $\mathbf{X}$ and $\mathbf{Y}$ with unknown respective marginals $H(dx)$ and $G(dy)$ and joint distribution $F(dx dy)$, based on {\it Receiver Operating Characteristic} (ROC) analysis and bipartite ranking.

item.title: GuideGen: A Text-guided Framework for Joint CT Volume and Anatomical structure Generation
item.description: Secondly, our Conditional Image Generator autoregressively generates CT slices conditioned on a corresponding mask slice to incorporate both style information and anatomical guidance.

item.title: Online Continual Learning For Interactive Instruction Following Agents
item.description: To take a step towards a more realistic embodied agent learning scenario, we propose two continual learning setups for embodied agents; learning new behaviors (Behavior Incremental Learning, Behavior-IL) and new environments (Environment Incremental Learning, Environment-IL) For the tasks, previous 'data prior' based continual learning methods maintain logits for the past tasks.

item.title: pyvene: A Library for Understanding and Improving PyTorch Models via Interventions
item.description: Interventions on model-internal states are fundamental operations in many areas of AI, including model editing, steering, robustness, and interpretability.

item.title: FairRR: Pre-Processing for Group Fairness through Randomized Response
item.description: The increasing usage of machine learning models in consequential decision-making processes has spurred research into the fairness of these systems.

item.title: Continual All-in-One Adverse Weather Removal with Knowledge Replay on a Unified Network Structure
item.description: It considers the characteristics of the image restoration task with multiple degenerations in continual learning, and the knowledge for different degenerations can be shared and accumulated in the unified network structure.

item.title: D4D: An RGBD diffusion model to boost monocular depth estimation
item.description: Ground-truth RGBD data are fundamental for a wide range of computer vision applications; however, those labeled samples are difficult to collect and time-consuming to produce.

item.title: SSM Meets Video Diffusion Models: Efficient Video Generation with Structured State Spaces
item.description: In the experiments, we first evaluate our SSM-based model with UCF101, a standard benchmark of video generation.

item.title: Couler: Unified Machine Learning Workflow Optimization in Cloud
item.description: This variety poses a challenge for end-users in terms of mastering different engine APIs.

item.title: Hunting Attributes: Context Prototype-Aware Learning for Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Inspired by prototype learning theory, we propose leveraging prototype awareness to capture diverse and fine-grained feature attributes of instances.

item.title: MoAI: Mixture of All Intelligence for Large Language and Vision Models
item.description: Therefore, we present a new LLVM, Mixture of All Intelligence (MoAI), which leverages auxiliary visual information obtained from the outputs of external segmentation, detection, SGG, and OCR models.

item.title: RSBuilding: Towards General Remote Sensing Image Building Extraction and Change Detection with Foundation Model
item.description: RSBuilding is designed to enhance cross-scene generalization and task universality.

item.title: Disentangling Policy from Offline Task Representation Learning via Adversarial Data Augmentation
item.description: Specifically, the objective of adversarial data augmentation is not merely to generate data analogous to offline data distribution; instead, it aims to create adversarial examples designed to confound learned task representations and lead to incorrect task identification.

item.title: Transforming Competition into Collaboration: The Revolutionary Role of Multi-Agent Systems and Language Models in Modern Organizations
item.description: This article explores the dynamic influence of computational entities based on multi-agent systems theory (SMA) combined with large language models (LLM), which are characterized by their ability to simulate complex human interactions, as a possibility to revolutionize human user interaction from the use of specialized artificial agents to support everything from operational organizational processes to strategic decision making based on applied knowledge and human orchestration.

item.title: SemCity: Semantic Scene Generation with Triplane Diffusion
item.description: In this paper, we concentrate on generating a real-outdoor scene through learning a diffusion model on a real-world outdoor dataset.

item.title: SVD-LLM: Truncation-aware Singular Value Decomposition for Large Language Model Compression
item.description: However, state-of-the-art SVD-based LLM compression methods have two key limitations: truncating smaller singular values may lead to higher compression loss, and the lack of update on the remaining model parameters after SVD truncation.

item.title: NavCoT: Boosting LLM-Based Vision-and-Language Navigation via Learning Disentangled Reasoning
item.description: Vision-and-Language Navigation (VLN), as a crucial research problem of Embodied AI, requires an embodied agent to navigate through complex 3D environments following natural language instructions.

item.title: Beyond Text: Frozen Large Language Models in Visual Signal Comprehension
item.description: To achieve this, we present the Vision-to-Language Tokenizer, abbreviated as V2T Tokenizer, which transforms an image into a ``foreign language'' with the combined aid of an encoder-decoder, the LLM vocabulary, and a CLIP model.

item.title: Lumen: Unleashing Versatile Vision-Centric Capabilities of Large Multimodal Models
item.description: This adaptation leads to convenient development of such LMMs with minimal modifications, however, it overlooks the intrinsic characteristics of diverse visual tasks and hinders the learning of perception capabilities.

item.title: Unleashing Network Potentials for Semantic Scene Completion
item.description: Semantic scene completion (SSC) aims to predict complete 3D voxel occupancy and semantics from a single-view RGB-D image, and recent SSC methods commonly adopt multi-modal inputs.

item.title: SMURF: Continuous Dynamics for Motion-Deblurring Radiance Fields
item.description: Neural radiance fields (NeRF) has attracted considerable attention for their exceptional ability in synthesizing novel views with high fidelity.

item.title: Characterization of Large Language Model Development in the Datacenter
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have presented impressive performance across several transformative tasks.

item.title: Robustifying and Boosting Training-Free Neural Architecture Search
item.description: Nevertheless, the estimation ability of these metrics typically varies across different tasks, making it challenging to achieve robust and consistently good search performance on diverse tasks with only a single training-free metric.

item.title: Joint Selection: Adaptively Incorporating Public Information for Private Synthetic Data
item.description: This technique allows for public data to be included in a graphical-model-based mechanism.

item.title: Fine-tuning Large Language Models with Sequential Instructions
item.description: Targeting the scarcity of sequential instructions in present-day data, we propose sequential instruction tuning, a simple yet effective strategy to automatically augment instruction tuning data and equip LLMs with the ability to execute multiple sequential instructions.

item.title: Harder Tasks Need More Experts: Dynamic Routing in MoE Models
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel dynamic expert selection framework for Mixture of Experts (MoE) models, aiming to enhance computational efficiency and model performance by adjusting the number of activated experts based on input difficulty.

item.title: WorkArena: How Capable Are Web Agents at Solving Common Knowledge Work Tasks?
item.description: We study the use of large language model-based agents for interacting with software via web browsers.

item.title: Bridging Different Language Models and Generative Vision Models for Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: In this paper, we explore this objective and propose LaVi-Bridge, a pipeline that enables the integration of diverse pre-trained language models and generative vision models for text-to-image generation.

item.title: Large Window-based Mamba UNet for Medical Image Segmentation: Beyond Convolution and Self-attention
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a Large Window-based Mamba U}-shape Network, or LMa-UNet, for 2D and 3D medical image segmentation.

item.title: Robust Synthetic-to-Real Transfer for Stereo Matching
item.description: With advancements in domain generalized stereo matching networks, models pre-trained on synthetic data demonstrate strong robustness to unseen domains.

item.title: Taming Pre-trained LLMs for Generalised Time Series Forecasting via Cross-modal Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Recently, with the surge of the Large Language Models (LLMs), several works have attempted to introduce LLMs into time series forecasting.

item.title: Frequency Decoupling for Motion Magnification via Multi-Level Isomorphic Architecture
item.description: To this end, we present FD4MM, a new paradigm of Frequency Decoupling for Motion Magnification with a Multi-level Isomorphic Architecture to capture multi-level high-frequency details and a stable low-frequency structure (motion field) in video space.

item.title: Masked AutoDecoder is Effective Multi-Task Vision Generalist
item.description: Inspired by the success of general-purpose models in NLP, recent studies attempt to unify different vision tasks in the same sequence format and employ autoregressive Transformers for sequence prediction.

item.title: Near-Interpolators: Rapid Norm Growth and the Trade-Off between Interpolation and Generalization
item.description: Under a random matrix theoretic assumption on the data distribution and an eigendecay assumption on the data covariance matrix $\boldsymbol{\Sigma}$, we demonstrate that any near-interpolator exhibits rapid norm growth: for $\tau$ fixed, $\boldsymbol{\beta}$ has squared $\ell_2$-norm $\mathbb{E}[\|{\boldsymbol{\beta}}\|_{2}^{2}] = \Omega(n^{\alpha})$ where $n$ is the number of samples and $\alpha >1$ is the exponent of the eigendecay, i. e., $\lambda_i(\boldsymbol{\Sigma}) \sim i^{-\alpha}$.

item.title: Triples-to-isiXhosa (T2X): Addressing the Challenges of Low-Resource Agglutinative Data-to-Text Generation
item.description: In this paper we tackle data-to-text for isiXhosa, which is low-resource and agglutinative.

item.title: Reinforced Sequential Decision-Making for Sepsis Treatment: The POSNEGDM Framework with Mortality Classifier and Transformer
item.description: Sepsis, a life-threatening condition triggered by the body's exaggerated response to infection, demands urgent intervention to prevent severe complications.

item.title: LookupFFN: Making Transformers Compute-lite for CPU inference
item.description: While GPU clusters are the de facto choice for training large deep neural network (DNN) models today, several reasons including ease of workflow, security and cost have led to efforts investigating whether CPUs may be viable for inference in routine use in many sectors of the industry.

item.title: 12 mJ per Class On-Device Online Few-Shot Class-Incremental Learning
item.description: In this work, we introduce Online Few-Shot Class-Incremental Learning (O-FSCIL), based on a lightweight model consisting of a pretrained and metalearned feature extractor and an expandable explicit memory storing the class prototypes.

item.title: DragAnything: Motion Control for Anything using Entity Representation
item.description: We introduce DragAnything, which utilizes a entity representation to achieve motion control for any object in controllable video generation.

item.title: Beyond Memorization: The Challenge of Random Memory Access in Language Models
item.description: Through carefully-designed synthetic tasks, covering the scenarios of full recitation, selective recitation and grounded question answering, we reveal that LMs manage to sequentially access their memory while encountering challenges in randomly accessing memorized content.

item.title: Efficient Diffusion Model for Image Restoration by Residual Shifting
item.description: While diffusion-based image restoration (IR) methods have achieved remarkable success, they are still limited by the low inference speed attributed to the necessity of executing hundreds or even thousands of sampling steps.

item.title: Unified Source-Free Domain Adaptation
item.description: To tackle this unified SFDA problem, we propose a novel approach called Latent Causal Factors Discovery (LCFD).

item.title: StableToolBench: Towards Stable Large-Scale Benchmarking on Tool Learning of Large Language Models
item.description: The virtual API server contains a caching system and API simulators which are complementary to alleviate the change in API status.

item.title: Ensembling Prioritized Hybrid Policies for Multi-agent Pathfinding
item.description: We first propose a selective communication block to gather richer information for better agent coordination within multi-agent environments and train the model with a Q-learning-based algorithm.

item.title: Equipping Computational Pathology Systems with Artifact Processing Pipelines: A Showcase for Computation and Performance Trade-offs
item.description: We developed DL pipelines using two MoEs and two multiclass models of state-of-the-art deep convolutional neural networks (DCNNs) and vision transformers (ViTs).

item.title: CuVLER: Enhanced Unsupervised Object Discoveries through Exhaustive Self-Supervised Transformers
item.description: In this paper, we introduce VoteCut, an innovative method for unsupervised object discovery that leverages feature representations from multiple self-supervised models.

item.title: Tuning diagonal scale matrices for HMC
item.description: Three approaches for adaptively tuning diagonal scale matrices for HMC are discussed and compared.

item.title: Chronos: Learning the Language of Time Series
item.description: We introduce Chronos, a simple yet effective framework for pretrained probabilistic time series models.

item.title: MAMMOTH: Massively Multilingual Modular Open Translation @ Helsinki
item.description: NLP in the age of monolithic large language models is approaching its limits in terms of size and information that can be handled.
